channel.title: Homes on René Reitmann
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on René Reitmann

item.description: Biography I am currently employed as DevOp and Scrum Master at the Research Data Center (FDZ) of the German Center for Higher Education and Science Research (DZHW). Since 2015, I (as part of an interdisciplinary team) have been developing a search and documentation portal for the data sets available at the FDZ. This portal is developed openly on GitHub. Before my time at the DZHW, I first worked as a consulting software engineer at Capgemini after studying economic mathematics at the Clausthal University of Technology.

item.title: Employers
item.description: During my studies and in years thereafter up to and including today I was employed by the following companies: DZHW (July 2015 - today) Software Engineer and Architect Zühlke Engineering (June 2010 - July 2015) Senior Software Engineer KKH (March 2010 - May 2010) IT-Coordinator Capgemini Germany (January 2006 - February 2010) IT Consultant Virtusa (November 2004 - March 2005) Intern innovative Systems (April 2004 - October 2004) Diploma/Student Trainee

item.title: Education
item.description: Certified Scrum Master at Scrum Alliance (April 2015) IREB Certified Professional for Requirements Engineering, Foundation Level (August 2011) ISTQB Certified Tester, Foundation Level (October 2010) Training „Conflict Management“ at Stöger & Partner (February 2009) School „SOA“ at Capgemini (November 2008) School „System Integration“ at Capgemini (March 2008) Training „Moderation“ at Stöger & Partner (October 2007) Training „Presentation“ at Stöger & Partner (December 2006) Studied Economic Mathematics at TU Clausthal and QUB Belfast (1999 - 2005), diploma grade: 1,3 Secondary School at Albert-Einstein-Schule KGS Laatzen (1991 - 1998), final grade: 1,8

item.title: Spare Time
item.description: If I’m not doing one of the roles I have mentioned earlier, here’s what I’m doing: Play Table Tennis at TSV Rethen Being Administrator of “WEG Fontainestraße 6” Play Pan-Pong Get informed about alternative school concepts like this
